sen.j: 路益人（みちのますひと、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: MICHI no Masuhito (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
MICHI no Masuhito (date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: MICHI no Masuhito (date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「みちのますひと」で同じ。
sen.e: His name is also pronounced "MICHI no Masuhito" in old Japanese syllabary characters.
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name is pronounced "MICHI no Masuhito."
sen.cmt: 「同じ」の意をわかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name is pronounced "MICHI no Masuhito."
His hereditary title was Atai (one of the upper title under Yamato dynasty).
His hereditary title was Atai (one of the upper title under Yamato dynasty).
His hereditary title was Atai (one of the upper title under Yamato dynasty).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従い、鈴鹿関に大津皇子を迎えに遣わされた。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War in 672 and was sent to the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint to pick up Prince Otsu.
He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War of 672 and was sent to the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint to pick up Prince Otsu.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War of 672 and was sent to the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint to pick up Prince Otsu.

sen.j: 路氏は東漢氏の一流で、渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: Michi clan was a member of the Yamatonoaya clan and were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Michi clan was a member of the Yamatonoaya clan and were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Michi clan was a member of the Yamatonoaya clan and were immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 路益人が壬申の乱の勃発時にどこで何をしていたのかはわからないが、大海人皇子が伊勢国に入った25日には、皇子のそばにいた。
sen.e: It is unknown where MICHI no Masuhito was or what he was doing when the Jinshin War started, but he was with Prince Oama when the prince arrived at Ise province on 25th.
It is unknown where MICHI no Masuhito was or what he was doing when the Jinshin War started, but he was with Prince Oama when the prince arrived at Ise Province on 25th.
It is unknown where MICHI no Masuhito was or what he was doing when the Jinshin War started, but he was with Prince Oama when the prince arrived at Ise Province on 25th.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の開始時に、大海人皇子は自ら吉野宮から東に向かうとともに、近江宮がある大津市にいる高市皇子と大津皇子に都からの脱出を指示した。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War started, Prince Oama departed from Yoshino no miya toward the east and ordered Prince Takechi and Prince Otsu to escape form Otsu City where Omi no miya located.
When the Jinshin War started, Prince Oama departed from Yoshino no miya toward the east and ordered Prince Takechi and Prince Otsu to escape from Otsu where Omi no miya located.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。またリンク表記で「大津市」となっていますが当時は「大津」なので（web表記も「大津」）、Cityは削除しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War started, Prince Oama departed from Yoshino no miya toward the east and ordered Prince Takechi and Prince Otsu to escape from Otsu where Omi no miya located.

sen.j: 二人の皇子はそれぞれ味方を連れて別々に脱出し、伊勢国に向かった父のあとを追った。
sen.e: The two princes escaped separately with followers and ran after their father heading to Ise province.
The two princes escaped separately with followers and ran after their father heading to Ise Province.
The two princes escaped separately with followers and ran after their father heading to Ise Province.

sen.j: このうち高市皇子は6月25日に合流を果たし、大津皇子はその日の深夜に伊勢の鈴鹿関にたどりついた。
sen.e: Prince Takechi joined on June 25 and the Prince Otsu got to the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise in the midnight of that day.
Prince Takechi joined his father's party on June 25 and Prince Otsu got to the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise in the midnight of that day.
sen.cmt: Princeのまえのtheを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Takechi joined his father's party on June 25 and Prince Otsu got to the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise in the midnight of that day.

sen.j: そこは大海人皇子がおいた500人の兵士が封鎖していた。
sen.e: The checkpoint was blocked by 500 soldiers loyal to Prince Oama.
The checkpoint was blocked by 500 soldiers loyal to Prince Oama.
The checkpoint was blocked by 500 soldiers loyal to Prince Oama.

sen.j: 大津皇子はただちに身元を明かすことをしなかったらしく、鈴鹿関司は、山部王と石川王が来たので関に留置したと大海人皇子に報せた。
sen.e: Since Prince Otsu didn't disclose his identity immediately, Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint officials reported to Prince Oama that they had Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) and Ishikawa no Okimi (Prince Ishikawa) in custody.

Since Prince Otsu didn't disclose his identity immediately, Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint officials reported to Prince Oama that they had Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) and Ishikawa no Okimi (Prince Ishikawa) in custody.

Since Prince Otsu didn't disclose his identity immediately, Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint officials reported to Prince Oama that they had Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) and Ishikawa no Okimi (Prince Ishikawa) in custody.

sen.j: このとき大海人皇子が二人の王を呼び寄せるために遣わしたのが、路益人であった。
sen.e: At this time, Prince Oama sent MICHI no Masuhito to pick up the two princes.
At this time, Prince Oama sent MICHI no Masuhito to pick up the two princes.
At this time, Prince Oama sent MICHI no Masuhito to pick up the two princes.

sen.j: 翌26日の朝、朝明郡の迹太川の岸で大海人皇子が天照大神を拝しているときに、路益人が来て「関で止められていたのは山部王・石川王ではなく、大津皇子だった」と報告した。
sen.e: The following morning on 26th, when Prince Oama was worshipping Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori county, MICHI no Masuhito arrived and reported that "prince kept in the checkpoint was neither Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) or Ishikawa no Okimi (Prince Ishikawa), he was Prince Otsu."

The following morning on 26th, when Prince Oama was worshipping Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori county, MICHI no Masuhito arrived and reported that "the prince kept at the checkpoint was neither Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) or Ishikawa no Okimi (Prince Ishikawa), but Prince Otsu."

The following morning on 26th, when Prince Oama was worshipping Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori county, MICHI no Masuhito arrived and reported that "the prince kept at the checkpoint was neither Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) or Ishikawa no Okimi (Prince Ishikawa), but Prince Otsu."

sen.j: 皇子の一行はすぐに益人に続いて現れた。
sen.e: The prince's party arrived right after Masuhito.
The prince's party arrived right after Masuhito.
The prince's party arrived right after Masuhito.

sen.j: 路益人についての記録は他にない。
sen.e: No other records for MICHI no Masuhito were kept.
There is no other records of MICHI no Masuhito.
sen.cmt: 自然な英文に修正しました。
sen.e: There is no other records of MICHI no Masuhito.
